management_and_clinical_course: Supportive care: management is therefore directed at support, symptomatic improvement and disease prevention. Symptomatic improvement: the majority of patients can walk with the aid of a stick or crutches and some will benefit from a wheelchair Disease prevention: there is no cure for patients with konzo because it results in a permanent spastic paraparesis
final_diagnosis: Clinical syndrome: spastic paraparesis Likely cause: chronic high dietary exposure of cyanogenic glycosides from insufficiently processed cassava tubers, but the exact pathogenic mechanism of konzo remain unknown. Confirmation method: symmetrical spastic paraparesis without sensory or genitourinary involvement Evidence: ["acute onset in less than 1 week with a non-progressive course", "occurring in a cassava-growing area, usually with other cases emerging at the same time"]
